captions.text:
Today I'm going to share the recipe to my
favorite DIY holiday hand scrub that leaves

my hands feeling soft and smelling like candy
canes during the cold, dry winter months.
So let's get started!

For this DIY, you will need some white sugar
to act as the exfoliate which will rid your

hands of dry dead skin cells on the surface,
and leave behind smoother hands.

Coconut oil which will add deep, natural mositure
to your hands. This will need to be liquified,
so add it to the microwave for 20-30 seconds.

And finally, peppermint essential oil which
will leave your scrub and hands smelling like

candy canes. You can find all of these ingredients
at your local grocery store.

So, let's begin! Fill up 2/3 of your jar or
container with the white sugar. Then fill

up the remaining 1/3 with the melted coconut
oil. Mix these two ingredients together really

well. Once you have finished that, add 2-4
drops of the peppermint oil. Mix the scrub

together once more, and you should be left
with a texture similar to wet snow.

Now that you have it made, you're probably
going to want to know how to use it. It's

simple! Just wet one hand with water and then
use a small scoop of the product to massage

into your hands. Then rinse it all off and
you will be left with super soft and lightly

moisturized hands that smell like candy
canes. If you have really dry hands, now is

a great time to use your favorite hand cream
as it will sink in and absorb into your hands

better than ever. And that's it! If you want
to make your jar a little more fancy-looking,

you can always add a ribbon and a label. A
perfect gift to keep or to give to a friend.

If you decide to give this DIY a try, please
share a photo with me using the hashtag #cutepolish

and let me know what you think of it! Take
care and I'll seeya next time!

title: DIY Holiday Candy Cane Hand Scrub | cutepolish
